channel.title: Firewall blocking ports
channel.description:
Hello dar, i recently decided to make another source (562).
I am portforwarding on the port 43594 and it works fine.. well... everything works fine if i put my Firewall off, but im not going to do that.
And i also tryed to add ports to firewall (43594). That does not work.
So:
- Portforwarding is fine - Server runs - Firewall blocks ports if it is online. - Server is multiplayer if i put it offline. - Do NOT want to put my firewall offline.
Help please. :)

item.title: Firewall blocking ports
item.dc:creator: @KempiScape KempiScape
item.description:
@KempiScape wrote:

Andrew Ferguson:

Your router itself probally has a build in firewall that is over powering the uTorrent at least that is how mine is (berklin router) try checking the firewall settings on the router itself.

At firewall in my router i had
Enable or disable Firewall module function : Enable or Disable

It was enabled so i disabled then. But it still doesnt work now

Read full topic

item.title: Firewall blocking ports
item.dc:creator: @KempiScape KempiScape
item.description:
@KempiScape wrote:

[quote=“Andrew Ferguson, post:2, topic:399391”]Well hello dar maty (never mind pirate talk is hurting my head) Hello there, please provide me with your method that you used to port forward. Did you do it directly? Or with some program like Utorrent.[/quote] I portforwarded with uTorrent, i also got a router. (Conceptronic C100BRS4H Broadband Router) I did read the guide on portforward.com but it wont go online after i did that. I think its the firewall again, uTorrent works fine if i put my firewall off.

Read full topic

item.title: Firewall blocking ports
item.dc:creator: @KempiScape KempiScape
item.description:
@KempiScape wrote:

Hello dar, i recently decided to make another source (562).

I am portforwarding on the port 43594 and it works fine… well…
everything works fine if i put my Firewall off, but im not going to do that.

And i also tryed to add ports to firewall (43594). That does not work.

So:

  • Portforwarding is fine
  • Server runs
  • Firewall blocks ports if it is online.
  • Server is multiplayer if i put it offline.
  • Do NOT want to put my firewall offline.

Help please.
